place.name: BULFORD
place.gazetteerText: BULFORD, a parish in Amesbury district, Wilts: on the river Avon, 2 miles NNE of Amesbury, and 4¾ N by W of Porton r. station. Post Town, Amesbury, under Salisbury. Acres, 3,475. Real property, with Durrington and Milston, £7,235. Pop., 383. Houses, 78. Bulford House is a chief residence. Some Druidical stones occur; and an earthwork, supposed to represent an ancient British village, is adjacent within Durrington. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Salisbury. Value, £75. Patron, Dr. Southby. The church is picturesque; and there is an Independent chapel. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
